Package org.apache.heron.common.basics

Class ByteAmount

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.heron.common.basics.ResourceMeasure<java.lang.Long>
      • org.apache.heron.common.basics.ByteAmount
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<ResourceMeasure<java.lang.Long>>
    public final class ByteAmount
extends ResourceMeasure<java.lang.Long>
    Class that encapsulates number of bytes, with helpers to handle units properly.

      • fromBytes

        public static ByteAmount fromBytes​(long bytes)
        Creates a ByteAmount value in bytes.
        Parameters:
        bytes - value in bytes to represent
        Returns:
        a ByteAmount object repressing the number of bytes passed

      • fromMegabytes

        public static ByteAmount fromMegabytes​(long megabytes)
        Creates a ByteAmount value in megabytes. If the megabytes value is $lt;= Long.MAX_VALUE / 1024 / 1024, the byte representation is capped at Long.MAX_VALUE.
        Parameters:
        megabytes - value in megabytes to represent
        Returns:
        a ByteAmount object repressing the number of MBs passed

      • fromGigabytes

        public static ByteAmount fromGigabytes​(long gigabytes)
        Creates a ByteAmount value in gigabytes. If the gigabytes value is >= Long.MAX_VALUE / 1024 / 1024 / 1024, the byte representation is capped at Long.MAX_VALUE.
        Parameters:
        gigabytes - value in gigabytes to represent
        Returns:
        a ByteAmount object repressing the number of GBs passed

      • asBytes

        public long asBytes()
        Returns the number of bytes associated with the ByteValue.
        Returns:
        number of bytes

      • asMegabytes

        public long asMegabytes()
        Converts the number of bytes to megabytes, rounding if there is a remainder. Because of loss of precision due to rounding, it's strongly advised to only use this method when it is certain that the only operations performed on the object were multiplication or addition and subtraction of other megabytes. If division or increaseBy were used this method could round up or down, potentially yielding unexpected results.
        Returns:
        returns the ByteValue in MBs or 0 if the value is < (1024 * 1024) / 2

      • asKilobytes

        public long asKilobytes()
        Converts the number of bytes to kilobytes, rounding if there is a remainder. Because of loss of precision due to rounding, it's strongly advised to only use this method when it is certain that the only operations performed on the object were multiplication or addition and subtraction of other megabytes. If division or increaseBy were used this method could round up or down, potentially yielding unexpected results.
        Returns:
        returns the ByteValue in KBs or 0 if the value is < (1024) / 2

      • asGigabytes

        public long asGigabytes()
        Converts the number of bytes to gigabytes, rounding if there is a remainder. Because of loss of precision due to rounding, it's strongly advised to only use this method when it is certain that the only operations performed on the object were multiplication or addition and subtraction of other gigabytes. If division or increaseBy were used this method could round up or down, potentially yielding unexpected results.
        Returns:
        returns the ByteValue in GBs or 0 if the value is < (1024 * 1024 * 1024) / 2

      • divide

        public ByteAmount divide​(int factor)
        Divides by factor, rounding any remainder. For example 10 bytes / 6 = 1.66 becomes 2. Use caution when dividing and be aware that because of precision lose due to round-off, dividing by X and multiplying back by X might not return the initial value.
        Specified by:
        divide in class ResourceMeasure<java.lang.Long>
        Parameters:
        factor - value to divide by
        Returns:
        a new ByteValue of this ByteValue divided by factor

      • increaseBy

        public ByteAmount increaseBy​(int percentage)
        Increases by a percentage, rounding any remainder. Be aware that because of rounding, increases will be approximate to the nearest byte.
        Specified by:
        increaseBy in class ResourceMeasure<java.lang.Long>
        Parameters:
        percentage - value to increase by
        Returns:
        a new ByteValue of this ByteValue increased by percentage
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if increase would exceed Long.MAX_VALUE

        public ByteAmount max​(ByteAmount other)
